reference_summary:
The Heat Sandra Bullock (Actor), Melissa McCarthy (Actor), Paul Feig (Director) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Michael Rapaport, Paul Feig, Taran Killam, Michael McDonald, Peter Chernin, Dan Bakkedahl, Brandon Richardson, Marlon Wayans, Sandra Bullock, Melissa McCarthy, Jenno Topping, Spoken Reasons, Katie Dippold, Tom Wilson, Demian Bichir, Jane CurtinMichael Rapaport, Paul Feig, Taran Killam, Michael McDonald, Peter Chernin, Dan Bakkedahl, Brandon Richardson, Marlon Wayans, Sandra Bullock, Melissa McCarthy, Jenno Topping, Spoken Reasons, Katie Dippold, Tom Wilson, Demian Bichir, Jane Curtin See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 57 minutes'} I did not like this movie AT ALL. I attempted to write a review without clicking any stars, but found that was impossible.

There was so much contention and foul language, I never figured out what the story line was. I bought it new right after it came out. A friend watched with me. We both felt the same about the movie, that it was a waste of money. I donated to Goodwill. Maybe they can make some money on it since it won awards. profile: The user demonstrates a strong preference for films with coherent storytelling and minimal reliance on crude humor or foul language. They've expressed disappointment with previous purchases that did not meet their standards, leading them to donate unsatisfactory items instead of keeping them. Their recent interaction indicates an appreciation for thrillers that combine engaging plots with quality production, as evidenced by their positive review and high rating for a film featuring a well-regarded cast. This suggests a continued inclination towards films that offer a compelling narrative experience, aligning with their established tastes. The user also actively shares their opinions on films, indicating that personal feedback influences their purchasing decisions. Their consistent behavior reflects a clear disdain for content that overly relies on conflict or crude humor, leaning instead towards genres that prioritize story quality and artistic execution.
